rows.RECRUITING PITCH DECK — SLIDE-BY-SLIDE C: Every hire sees this before saying yes. 5 slides. Sendable as PDF or Notion link. AI-designed.
Headline: We're building a company the way no one has before.

rows.col_2: IonWave — a premium electrolyte supplement designed to compete with LMNT, Liquid IV, and Drip Drop.

We're building the entire company — not just the product — using a 1,200-tab operating model called "The Trade." Every function (marketing, supply chain, finance, legal, content) is designed by specialized co-founders, verified by domain experts, and documented as a playbook a CEO can inherit and run.
Every conversation is an episode. We're documenting the entire process as a live show. You won't just build something — you'll be part of a public story.

Most companies fail because they build product first and figure out operations later. We're doing it backwards — building the operating system first, then launching the product into a verified machine.

rows.RECRUITING PITCH DECK — SLIDE-BY-SLIDE C: Headline: This isn't someone's first startup.

rows.col_2: Nilo Vicioso — COO of Tabs (viral chocolate brand, $25M raised, 100M+ monthly organic views). Partner at an ecommerce venture fund. YC/Greylock/KV-backed founder. Has launched 7 businesses through Studio 4.
The Trade isn't a business plan — it's a coordination protocol backed by original research on how flash teams and AI-assisted production can replace traditional management.
Claude (Anthropic's AI) produces ~80% of first-draft content. Humans refine, verify, and own. This is how companies will be built in 2026.
Tabs went from zero to 100M+ organic monthly views. The same systematic approach — but applied to building the entire company, not just the content.
Real ownership in a real company. Vests monthly — if you leave after 3 weeks, you keep 3 weeks of equity. No cliff games.
Your name on every TUP (unit of work) you produce. "Co-Founded by [You]" on verified, expert-graded work product.
You'll be on the show. Your onboarding is an episode. Your work is documented. Your expert review is content. You're building your public portfolio.
"I co-founded the [marketing / supply chain / finance] function of a venture-backed company, verified by a domain expert, documented on a show with [X] subscribers."
We're not paying salaries right now. This is honest. You're betting your time on equity + career value. We think the bet is worth it. You decide.
Founder. Wrote the thesis. Designed the Trade. On-call for questions.
Librarian. Information architect. Managing the 1,200-tab system.
Host. Producing the show. Documenting everything.
Talent. Finding the co-founders.
AI production engine. 80% of first-draft content. Your collaborator, not your replacement.
